Ph.D student at IRIT-CNRS
Toulouse, France

Welcome

I am a CNRS Ph.D candidate within the SC team of IRIT, the computer science research institute of Toulouse. I will defend my Ph.D thesis in November 2021. I work under the supervision of Cédric Févotte, Édouard Pauwels and Jérôme Bolte. I am a member of the FACTORY project.

I was previously a six-month intern under the supervision of Pierre Weiss and Frédéric de Gournay where I was working on Semi-infinite Programming and Inverse Problems. I both graduated from INSA Toulouse and Université Paul Sabatier where I obtained master's degrees respectively in "Applied Mathematics and Modeling" and "Applied Mathematics, major: Partial Differential Equations".

My research focuses on optimization algorithms for Deep Learning and Machine Learning. I also spend a reduced amount of time giving tutorials and practicals at INP ENSEEIHT where I teach Probabilities, Statistics and Integration Theory to master students.

Research Interests

  • Nonconvex Optimization
  • Deep Learning
  • Statistics and Machine Learning Theory
